Spans.Span: This specification is the specification for developers of OPC UA applications. The specification is a result of an analysis and design process to develop a standard interface to facilitate the development of applications by multiple vendors that shall inter-operate seamlessly together.

Any unauthorized use of this specification may violate copyright laws, trademark laws, and communications regulations and statutes. This document contains information which is protected by copyright. The OPC Foundation strives to maintain the highest quality standards for its published specifications; hence they undergo constant review and refinement. Readers are encouraged to report any issues and view any existing errata here: H
This document specifies an OPC UA information model to expose information, at what dates and times specific actions are executed by the OPC UA
. Those schedules can optionally also be manipulated via the information model.

The schedule defines on which dates they are active, and can also reference global calendars representing specific dates, for example public holidays. In addition, the schedule defines times and actions that should be executed at that time. The model defines writing
, but can be extended to other actions as well.

The following referenced documents are indispensable for the application of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments and errata) applies.
OPC Unified Architecture - Part 1: Overview and Concepts
OPC Unified Architecture - Part 3: Address Space Model
OPC Unified Architecture - Part 5: Information Model

It is assumed that basic concepts of OPC UA information modelling are understood in this document. This document will use these concepts to describe the Scheduler Information Model. For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in OPC 10000-1, OPC 10000-3, OPC 10000-4, OPC 10000-5, OPC 10000-7 as well as the following apply.
Note that OPC UA terms and terms defined in this document are
Schedulers allow to define per day of the week specific times at which specific actions are executed in the OPC UA
In addition, schedulers can define special dates and times at which specific actions are executed in the OPC UA
. If such a date occurs, the actions of the special date are executed, and the weekly schedule is ignored.
A scheduler can define the special dates by either
defining a range of dates (e.g. 2022-01-17 until 2022-04-13)
defining repeating dates with wildcards (e.g. every 1
or referencing global calendars containing for example all public holidays of a year
Per date an array of times and corresponding actions including parameterization is defined, when the action is executed. Actions can be the writing of
, but can also be extended to other actions.
UC01: Scheduling actions on specific times on each weekday
The user wants to schedule that at specific times on each individual weekday a specific action is executed, for example the heating is set to a specific setpoint. In

, an example of such a schedule is given. It contains the schedule for the heating of a school building, that is not used over the weekend. It may be needed to disable the schedule, e.g. when it is warm outside during summer.
UC02: Scheduling actions on special dates

The user wants to schedule that on special dates or date periods a specific action is executed, for example switching off the heating during public holidays. The user wants to be able to define those dates individual or reference predefined dates that can be used in several schedules. In
The referenced calendars are defined in
The example shows more detailed use cases, summarized in the following subsections.
UC002.1: Schedule actions at a specific date
in the third entry, a special schedule on a specific date (2022-04-01) shall be applied.
UC002.2: Schedule actions at an interval from a specific date to a specific date
in the second entry, a special schedule on a specific interval (2022-04-03 – 2022-04-07) shall be applied.
UC002.3 Schedule actions at a recurring interval
in the first entry, a special schedule on a recurring interval (every Saturday per of March 2022) shall be applied.
UC002.4 Schedule actions at specific dates defined globally
in the last three entries, a special schedule shall be applied on dates defined globally. The global definition shall support concrete dates (CAL1), recurring dates (CAL2) and concrete ranges (CAL3).
represent a globally defined set of dates that can be referenced by schedule
an instance of ScheduleType represent a schedule, that defines for specific dates or weekdays specific times and actions, that shall be executed at those times.
, defining per weekday specific times and per specific time a list of actions that shall be executed at that time. Optionally, the
can be configured by OPC UA
In addition, or as alternative, a schedule
. This defines special dates (days), either by defining a concrete date, a range of dates, or recurring dates, or by referencing instances of
can be used to configure the
can be used to manipulate the
This specification does not define any specific entry points where to find schedule or calendar
. It is expected that they are placed reasonable in the AddressSpace, for example as child
that is manipulated by actions of the schedule
This specification does not define any specific mechanism how new schedule or calendar Objects are added or removed via OPC UA. Information Models using those
with one entry per weekday and / or an
. One of both shall be defined. The
contains for each day actions, that should be taken at specific times. The
contains specific dates or ranges of dates, and the corresponding actions that should be taken at specific times. For example, the
can contain an entry with all public holidays and another with plant holidays. Since the different entries of the
might overlap, each entry contains a priority. If overlapping entries exist, the one with the highest priority is used. If both,
exist, the exception schedule has priority over the
. That is, if the exception schedule has a matching date, the exception schedule is used, otherwise the weekly schedule.
When a Server restarts or starts the first time, and when a schedule
) there are two options how a schedule

shall find the last set of actions to be executed before the current time and execute those actions. The mechanism to find the last set of actions is to find the last element in the list of TimeActionsType that occurs on or before the current time, and then use that element’s actions. If no such element is found, then no action is executed.
does not consider any previous actions and starts executing actions according to the defined schedule defined in the future.
provides a list of calendar dates. Each entry in the list describes a specific date or date pattern, or range of dates. The
Provides a list of calendar dates. Each entry in the list describes a specific date or date pattern, or range of dates
indicates the current value of the calendar: True if the current date is in the
and False if it is not. For the current date that local time of the OPC UA Server shall be considered.
is an array of elements of which each is either a specific date or date pattern, or range of dates.
– CalendarType Attribute values for child Nodes
Indicates if the current date is in the DateList (true) or not (false)
Array of elements each defining either a specific date or date pattern, or range of dates
. Even if one entry cannot be added, the other entries are still processed and added, if possible. The signature of this
An array of calendar entries to be added to the DateList Property.
An array of results, one entry per entry in CalendarEntries, indicating if the individual entry could be added. Each result <> 0 indicates, that adding this calendar entry was not successful.
-2 – Invalid Format – The entry contains an invalid format, e.g. an invalid range
Values larger 0 can be used for vendor-specific errors.
Method Result Codes (defined in Call Service)
. Even if one entry cannot be removed, the other entries are still processed and removed, if possible. The signature of this
An array of calendar entries to be removed from the DateList Property.
An array of results, one entry per entry in CalendarEntries, indicating if the individual entry could be removed. Each result <> 0 indicates, that removing this calendar entry was not successful.
-1 – Not found – Entry is not in DateList
Values larger 0 can be used for vendor-specific errors.
Method Result Codes (defined in Call Service)

defines a periodic schedule that can recur over a range of dates. The schedule may have optional exceptions at arbitrary times or dates. The basic unit of a schedule is days, which are divided into two types: normal days within a week and exception days. A priority mechanism defines which scheduled event is currently valid. The

Defines a periodic schedule that can recur over a range of dates. The schedule may have optional exceptions at arbitrary times or dates. The basic unit of a schedule is days, which are divided into two types: normal days within a week and exception days. A priority mechanism defines which scheduled event is currently valid. The schedule includes a PresentValue Variable whose value describes the current state of the schedule, including a default value when no schedules are in effect.
. If present, each of those special events describes a sequence of schedule actions that take precedence over a normal day’s behaviour on a special day or days.

. Each entry represents one day of the week. The first entry in the array represents Monday, the last Sunday. Each element describes a sequence of times and a list of actions that provides a sequence of schedule actions on one day of the week when no
At least one of the two
should be used. This simplifies adding and removing entries of the array. As the
is a fixed-size array with a length of 7, there are no corresponding
. Instead, an individual entry of the array may be written by the
to change only the schedule of one weekday.
provides information about the local time of the schedule
. All scheduled times are UTC time. Clients need to consider this
to calculate the local time of the schedule. If this Property is changed, it is server-specific whether the times of the schedule are adjusted or not. If the
the schedule is defined for are in the same local time, the
specifies the range of dates within which the schedule
is active. Upon entering its effective period, the object shall execute the defined actions at the defined times, otherwise it shall not execute any actions.
defines if the last set of actions shall be applied when starting the schedule
– ScheduleType Attribute values for child Nodes
An array of special events. If present, each of those special events describes a sequence of schedule actions that take precedence over a normal day’s behaviour on a special day or days.

Each entry represents one day of the week. The first entry in the array represents Monday, the last Sunday. Each element describes a sequence of times and a list of actions that provides a sequence of schedule actions on one day of the week when no ExceptionSchedule is in effect.

Provides information about the local time of the schedule Object. All scheduled times are UTC time. Clients need to consider this Property to calculate the local time of the schedule. If this Property is changed, it is server-specific whether the times of the schedule are adjusted or not.

Specifies the range of dates within which the schedule Object is active. Upon entering its effective period, the object shall execute the defined actions at the defined times, otherwise it shall not execute any actions.
The ApplyLastAfterStart Property defines if the last set of actions shall be applied when starting the schedule Object
. Even if one entry cannot be added, the other entries are still processed and added, if possible. The signature of this
An array of special events to be added to the ExceptionSchedule Property.
An array of results, one entry per entry in SpecialEvents, indicating if the individual entry could be added. Each result <> 0 indicates, that adding this special event entry was not successful.
-2 – Invalid Format – The entry contains an invalid format, e.g. an invalid range
Values larger 0 can be used for vendor-specific errors.
Method Result Codes (defined in Call Service)
. Even if one entry cannot be removed, the other entries are still processed and removed, if possible. The signature of this
An array of special events to be removed from the ExceptionSchedule Property.
An array of results, one entry per entry in SpecialEvents, indicating if the individual entry could be removed. Each result <> 0 indicates, that removing this special event entry was not successful.
-1 – Not found – Entry is not in ExceptionSchedule
Values larger 0 can be used for vendor-specific errors.
Method Result Codes (defined in Call Service)
This structure contains a period, a list of time actions, and a priority. It is a means to identify moments in time over one or more days. How the priority is used is defined in section
A period where the special event is active
Points in time where the special event occurs and the associated actions
Priority of this special event. The lower the number, the higher the priority.
This structure contains a period, a list of time values, and a priority. It is a means to identify moments in time over one or more days.
This union contains a calendar entry or a reference to a calendar
This union contains a calendar entry or a reference to a calendar object
This union that defines various calendar date values. The union is defined in
A calendar date, potentially partly defined and repeating
Its representation in the AddressSpace is defined in
This union that defines various calendar date values

This structure defines a calendar date. It allows to define a concrete date, e.g. 2022-02-12. By using wildcards, it also allows to define repeating dates, like every Wednesday, every odd day of a month, every 24
of December, every last day of a month in 2023, etc. Its composition is formally defined in
Years based on the Gregorian calendar, 0 is used as “unspecific”.
A specific Gregorian calendar month or relative (e.g. “odd”, “even”)
A specific day of the month or relative (e.g. “last day”). Shall be “unspecific” if DayOfWeek is not “unspecific”.
A specific day of the week. Shall be “unspecific” if DayOfMonth is not “unspecific”.
Its representation in the AddressSpace is defined in

This structure defines a calendar date. It allows to define a concrete date, e.g. 2022-02-12. By using wildcards, it also allows to define repeating dates, like every Wednesday, every odd day of a month, every 24
of December, every last day of a month in 2023, etc.
This enumeration indicates either a specific Gregorian calendar month, or a relative relationship (“odd”, “even”, and “unspecified”). The enumeration is defined in
Its representation in the AddressSpace is defined in
This enumeration indicates either a specific Gregorian calendar month, or a relative relationship (“odd”, “even”, and “unspecified”).

This enumeration indicates specific days of the month by specific date (“1”, “22”, and so on) or by relative position (“last day of month”, “even day of month”, and so on). The enumeration is defined in
This enumeration indicates specific days of the month by specific date (“1”, “22”, and so on) or by relative position (“last day of month”, “even day of month”, and so on).
This enumeration indicates each of the seven days of the week, or “unspecified”. The enumeration is defined in
This enumeration indicates each of the seven days of the week, or “unspecified”.
Subtype of the 0:Enumeration type defined in
This structure defines a time span, with start and end dates that are either open or absolute. The structure is defined in
are limited to either use specific dates, i.e., wild cards like odd months are not allowed, or unspecified dates, i.e. only use wild cards.
In case a specific date is provided, the
field shall be a value between 1 to 12; the
field shall be between 1 to 31 and the
In case an unspecified date is provided, the
No other values shall be used for
The start date of the date range. The start day is included in the range.
The end date of the date range. The end day is included in the range.

This structure defines a time span, with absolute start and end dates. The StartDate and EndDate are limited to specific values, i.e., wild cards like odd months are not allowed. The Year field shall not be 0; the Month field shall be a value between 1 to 12; the DayOfMonth field shall be between 1 to 31 and the DayOfMonth field shall be “unspecified”.
This structure contains a time and an array of actions. It is used to define which actions shall be executed at a specific point in time. The structure is defined in
A point in time during a day
A list of actions to be executed at the defined Time
Note: Here, subtypes are allowed. The table format will be updated, once a final format is defined.
This structure contains a time and an array of actions. It is used to define actions to be executed at a specific point in time.
This abstract structure defines the base of an action. The base only contains information, if the last execution of the action was successful. The structure is defined in

Contains information, whether the last execution of the action was successful. Shall be Uncertain, if action was never executed or last execution not known by Server anymore, e.g., because of a restart.
Shall be a good status code when execution of action was successful, and a bad status code, when execution was not successful.
Subtypes might add additional information on execution of action, e.g. output arguments.
This abstract structure defines the base of an action. The base only contains information, if the last execution of the action was successful.
This structure defines an action to write the value of a
where the action is used. The structure is defined in
The NodeId of the Variable to be written
The value to be written to the Variable
This structure defines an action to write the value of a Variable managed in the same Server where the action is used.
This structure defines an action to call a
where the action is used. The structure is defined in
The NodeId of the Object the Method should be called on
The NodeId of the Method to be called
An array of input values to be used in the Method call

An array of the output values the last time the Method was called. Shall be an empty array if no outputs arguments, the LastActionResult is a bad status code or the action was never executed or last execution is unknown.
This structure defines an action to call a Method of an Object managed in the same Server where the action is used.
This structure that represents a point in time during a day. The structure is defined in
Allowed values between 0 and 23 – 255 as unspecific
Allowed values between 0 and 59 – 255 as unspecific
Allowed values between 0 and 59 – 255 as unspecific
This structure that represents a point in time during a day
This structure defines a sequence of
structures. Each element in the sequence defines a time and a list of actions that shall be executed at that point in time. The structure is defined in
A sequence of time / value pairs describing the value at a given point in the day.
This structure defines a sequence of TimeActionsType structures. Each element in the sequence defines a time/actions pair that describes the actions to be executed at a given point in the day.
Editor comment: This section will not be published in this document, but in the Profile database and OPC 10000-7 Profiles
for the OPC UA Information Model for Scheduler.

Exposes the ObjectType ScheduleType, the DataTypes SpecialEventType, SpecialEventPeriodType, CalendarEntryType, DateType, Month, DayOfMonth, DayOfWeek, DateRangeType, TimeActionsType, BaseActionType, WriteLocalVariableActionType, CallLocalMethodActionType, TimeType and DailyScheduleType and all their supertypes in the AddressSpace.

Supports a configuration with at least two instances of ScheduleType having at least 12 entries of DaySchedule in their WeeklySchedule (overall, not per day), and 6 entries in the ExceptionSchedule each having at least 6 entries of ListOfTimeActions.
Exposes the ObjectType CalendarType, the DataTypes CalendarEntryType, DateType, Month, DayOfMonth, DayOfWeek, and DateRangeType and all their supertypes in the AddressSpace.
Supports a configuration with at least three instances of CalendarType, each having at least 10 entries in DateList.

Supports at least on instance of ScheduleType supporting the Methods AddExceptionScheduleElements and RemoveExceptionScheduleElements to change the ExceptionSchedule Property and allowing writing the WeeklySchedule Property.
Supports at least on instance of CalendarType supporting the Methods AddDateListElements and RemoveDateListElements to change the DateList Property.
The client supports the configuration of instances of ScheduleType and CalendarType, by changing the configuration of existing Objects.
